items.title: Trump Officials Float New Plan for Abrego Garcia: Send Him to Liberia
items.summary: The proposal was the latest twist in a byzantine saga that has transformed the Salvadoran migrant into one of the best-known symbols of President Trump’s aggressive deportation agenda.

items.title: Amid the Rubble of the East Wing, Lessons in How Trump Exercises Power
items.summary: From the first day of his second term, President Trump has taken an ends-justify-the-means approach to his presidency.

items.title: Republicans Who Have Rarely Opposed Trump Raise Questions About His Drug War
items.summary: The president said he wouldn’t seek congressional approval for his expanding military offensive against cartels, but some in his party believe Congress should weigh in.

items.title: 2 People Shot at Protest Site Outside Coast Guard Base in California
items.summary: Coast Guard police fired rounds at a moving van that accelerated toward the base in reverse and did not follow commands to stop, the authorities say.

items.title: A Restaurant Run by Teens in a Town Overrun by Guns
items.summary: Shootings have long plagued the city of Montgomery, Ala., where poverty levels are high and good jobs are scarce. That’s My Dog Jr. offers teenagers a moneymaking opportunity — and $3.99 hot dogs.

items.title: U.S. Deploys Aircraft Carrier to Latin America as Drug Operation Expands
items.summary: The Trump administration has acknowledged 10 strikes on suspected drug-smuggling boats from South America, which have killed 43 people.

items.title: Schumer says Democrats will force vote to overturn Canada tariffs as Carney says nation ‘stands ready’ to continue US trade talks – live
items.summary: <p>Democratic leader calls Canada tariffs ‘damaging’ and vows effort to overturn them; Canadian prime minister says he wants to see progress on trade negotiations</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/24/trump-canada-trade-negotations-ontario-tariffs">US and Canada spar over anti-Trump tariff ad that suspended trade talks</a></p></li></ul><p><strong>The US secretary of state has confirmed Donald Trump’s announcement that all trade negotiations with Canada have been suspended.</strong></p><p>Marco Rubio spoke during a visit to a civil-military coordination centre in southern Israel.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/oct/24/donald-trump-trade-negotiations-canada-mark-carney-terminated-tariff-letitia-james-new-york-us-politics-live-news">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: US airstrike on ‘drug boat’ kills six as aircraft carrier sent to South America
items.summary: <p>Pete Hegseth claims six ‘narco-terrorists’ killed in Caribbean as US military conducts 10th strike </p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/oct/24/donald-trump-trade-negotiations-canada-mark-carney-terminated-tariff-letitia-james-new-york-us-politics-live-news">US politics live – latest updates</a></p></li></ul><p>The United States has carried out another military strike against a boat it claims was carrying illegal drugs in the Caribbean, killing six people onboard, the Pentagon chief, Pete Hegseth, said on Friday morning.</p><p>Later on Friday, the Pentagon <a href="https://x.com/SeanParnellASW/status/1981759934539985132">said</a> that an aircraft carrier was being moved to waters off South America, as part of the administration’s stated campaign to combat drug trafficking.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/24/us-military-strike-alleged-drug-boat-caribbean">Continue reading...</a>
